Did you know most rivers get their start at the top of a mountain. The snow and ice from the mountaintop melts and trickles down the side of the mountain. As more and more water trickles down, it forms a stream, which is basically just a tiny river. Eventually, multiple streams are formed and they come together to form a river.

Mrs. Lewis' 2nd graders learned all about how rivers form and what happens when it rains on mountains during their science experiment.

Congratulations to our Knob Noster FFA Chapter!

Last week, FFA members attended a ceremony where they were awarded Overall Champion Chapter of the 2019-2020 FFA Fantasy Feedout sponsored by Missouri Cattlemen's Association. Our students started the competition at the University of Missouri in Columbia last December with over 350 FFA students representing 23 chapters from across the state at FFA Draft Day.

The Knob Noster FFA Team earned 1,770 points over the course of the program based on their steer's quality, yield and profitability. Scoring 287 points above the chapter coming in second place, our students competed very well! The chapter was awarded a $2,000 check, a plaque, and Chapter Champion jackets.

Thank you to the Missouri Cattlemen's Association for supporting FFA!

#KNPantherPride #OurMissionIsStudentSuccess Knob Noster Ffa

#20ThingstoKnow
The first day/week/month of school is the time to set good attendance habits for the year. When a student is absent, he/she misses the best opportunity for learning - in the classroom or virtually with his/her teacher. We believe that school success goes hand-in-hand with good attendance and we want all our Panthers to be successful. Some tips for helping with attendance include setting a regular bedtime routine and getting school items ready the night before, having a back-up plan for getting to school - maybe a relative, friend or neighbor, and working to schedule appointments on days school is not in session or at least being in school for as much of the day as you can before or after the appointment.
Reminder: We also want our Panthers safe and healthy to be successful. If your child has symptoms of illness, he/she should stay home.

Due to the increased demand of their 26-county service area, Harvesters is out of food for school pantries at this time. We regretfully announce that our school district is not receiving a delivery of food this month from Harvesters and will not have a Panther Pantry in May. We are hopeful that the Harvesters delivery will resume in August or September and will post the next Panther Pantry as soon as we are notified.

As a reminder, KNPS continues to distribute free Grab & Go meals through our Food Service Department this month. We invite families to pick up meals on Monday, May 18 and Tuesday, May 26 9am-12pm at the KNMS back parking lot. Meals are available to all individuals 18 years of age and younger and all individuals with special needs 21 years of age and younger.

HQ AFJROTC announces that MO-20052, TRIAD AFJROTC, has been selected as one of 387 (out of almost 1,000) units to receive the 2019-2020 Air Force JROTC Distinguished Unit Award. This award recognizes Air Force JROTC units that have performed well above and beyond normal expectations, and that have distinguished themselves through outstanding service to their school and community while meeting the Air Force JROTC citizen development mission for America. "

TRIAD AFJROTC is comprised of three schools: Warrensburg High School, La Monte High School and is hosted by Knob Noster High School. The unit, started in 2005, is comprised of 120 cadets from the three schools. TRIAD (named for the three Air Force Core values: Integrity. Service, and Excellence) is noted for their outstanding community service and state and national ranked teams such as Raiders, Drill, and CyberPatriot.
